title: SoC MTS 525-0-26 Special Topics Research Seminar

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course is for graduate students who will conduct qualitative research on the behavioral and social aspects of technology use and technology design. The objective of this course is to give students practical, hands-on experience with interviewing, observation, and qualitative analysis techniques. The course is run as a seminar, and students will be responsible for leading discussion on weekly readings. Assignments throughout the term will allow students to apply the methods discussed in class. Students are encouraged collect and analyze data related to their own research as part of the course. In addition to mini-assignments, students will submit a final course project in which they are expected to apply the methods learned about in the course.

subject: MTS
